titles.title: Commemorative Coins Reform Act of 2015
To prohibit the payment of surcharges for commemorative coin programs to private organizations or entities, and for other purposes.
Commemorative Coins Reform Act of 2015

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bill.summary:
Commemorative Coins Reform Act of 2015
This bill prohibits surcharges generated by the sale of any numismatic item or commemorative coin program from being paid to a non-federal organization, except with respect to sales and production costs.
Surcharges must be used to recover all numismatic operation and program costs allocable to the program under which a numismatic item is produced and sold.
Any excess surcharges must be transferred to the general fund of the Treasury for deficit reduction purposes.
